channel.title: Portal 2 Comic
channel.description: IGN show up part one of Portal 2 comic, which is basically promised by Valve bridge between two games, and it's amazing! Also, keep an eye on HL references :wink: Part One: [url]https://comics.ign.com/articles/116/1160605p1.html[/url] Part One(more likable site): [url]https://www.thinkwithportals.com/comic/[/url] Part Two: [url]https://comics.ign.com/articles/116/1161043p1.html[/url]

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
Dead Phil:

They only had that song at the end for fun

Citation needed.
As long as you have no source for this statement there is no reason to ignore the song in relation to the story. It is totally canon and - like a movie score - semantically connected to the events in the game (in movie scores, this counts for the end credits as well).

GARD:

What exactly is wrong about my statement?

You are disregarding the facts, in that case: Still alive. That’s what I wanted to point out. But please let me explain a little more:

GARD:

But you go on to interpret yourself?

It is a song. Don’t read too much into it.

There is a difference between reading stuff into something and reading stuff OUT of something. The latter is the basis of good interpretation. So when I said “not much room for interpretation” I actually meant “I wonder if you would read something different out of the quoted song passage”. Sorry for the confusion.

I tried to stick to the song text as closely as possible when interpreting it in my previous post - please feel free to show me where other interpretations are plausible as well. I wonder if you would read something different out of the quoted song passage

GARD:

If you went back and played the game you would realize that glados is one of the most SARCASTIC video-game antagonists ever. She’s probably not “happy for you”.

Nothing wrong with that, except that you cannot read out of the song whether she is lying or not. So assuming that it is indeed all sarcastic, that is reading stuff into the song. That’s why I said your statement was wrong (btw, I know it’s rude to say such things the way I did, so my apologies good sir), because I see no hints or facts that point only toward your hypothesis.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: Dead_Phil
item.description:
They only had that song at the end for fun, remember valve didn’t think portal was going to be a big hit like it ended up as. the song really has no signifigant relation to the story

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: GARD
item.description:
What exactly is wrong about my statement?

JerseyRyan:

I don’t see much room for interpretation here. It reads like killing GLaDOS was part of the beta testing. GLaDOS did expect its own death. That’s what bugs me so much about Portal: No matter what you do, you can never tell whether GLaDOS has foreseen all of your actions or whether you’re a rebel. Is chell a heroine or just a lab rat?

But you go on to interpret yourself?

It is a song. Don’t read too much into it.
If you went back and played the game you would realize that glados is one of the most SARCASTIC video-game antagonists ever. She’s probably not “happy for you”. Either way, this is what i think, because you think/have interpreted something different, does not necessarily make it wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: DarkSoroush
item.description:
Yes, they had installed a ‘Morality Core’ in GLaDOS, thinking it would stop her attempted murder.

And it works. Stopped her from killing people without reason.
She now kills people for science.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
GARD:

Glados tries to kill Chell. She didn’t expect Chell to survive. Still Alive probably just indicates that glados is, indeed, still somewhat alive - hence you “restart” her in Portal 2.

That’s wrong. I highly recommend you to read the lyrics of Still Alive once again. GLaDOS there basically states that killed test subjects are part of its test program. Actually she refers to the killed test subjects as “mistakes”. Here let me quote something:

for the good of all of us except for the ones who are dead
but there’s no sense crying over every mistake
you just keep on trying until you run out of cake
and the science gets done and you make a neat gun
for the people who are still alive.

[When you killed me] I was so happy for you!
Now these points of data make a wonderful line
and we’re out of beta, we’re releasing on time
so I’m glad I got burned
Think of all the things we learned for the people that are still alive

I don’t see much room for interpretation here. It reads like killing GLaDOS was part of the beta testing. GLaDOS did expect its own death. That’s what bugs me so much about Portal: No matter what you do, you can never tell whether GLaDOS has foreseen all of your actions or whether you’re a rebel. Is chell a heroine or just a lab rat?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: DeleteThis
item.description:
Actonide:

They went straight from “it tries to kill us 1/10 of a picosecond after we start it up” to “neurotoxin? as long as it’s for science…”? Maybe it’s a good thing they had less funding than Black Mesa… Black Mesa never would have done that.

Right, Black Mesa is more into messing with unknown chemicals from other dimensions just to see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: Theevilpplz
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

I would say that it is canon, since Valve pretty much hired a writer and an artist to make this story under their direct supervision.

IIRC, the writers and artists of this comic were already employed by Valve.
Why get outside people to do it (even if under your surpervision), if you can get the people who have worked hard on the portal universe themselves to do it?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
sersoft:

chell was the most stubborn test subject on file or something, it shows on the very last page of the comic, also glados seems to think ratman will come to her rescue so she brings her to the fire(in portal 1) but the ratman probably planned ahead and left clues on the walls so that chell could escape from the trap and have a chance to defeat glados

No, he 100% left clues because they are there in portal 1.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: GARD
item.description:
JerseyRyan:

Then tell me: Was GLaDOS destroyed, because Chell defeated it on her own or was GLaDOS planning its destruction as the final exam of the tests?

The latter seems more probable, considering the song “Still Alive”, the cake room with the remaining personality cores and Doug Ratman’s statement “She is in the final chamber [with GLaDOS]”.

But then again: Why did he pick Chell anyway? To defeat GLaDOS? Why did he pick someone stubborn if not to resist the tests?

I never know when Chell actually rebels against GLaDOS or when she does something GLaDOS expected (or even hoped for).

Basically this:

sersoft:

also glados seems to think ratman will come to her rescue so she brings her to the fire(in portal 1) but the ratman probably planned ahead and left clues on the walls so that chell could escape from the trap and have a chance to defeat glados

Glados tries to kill Chell. She didn’t expect Chell to survive. Still Alive probably just indicates that glados is, indeed, still somewhat alive - hence you “restart” her in Portal 2.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
GARD:

… How can you not be sure? It’s pretty clear.

Then tell me: Was GLaDOS destroyed, because Chell defeated it on her own or was GLaDOS planning its destruction as the final exam of the tests?

The latter seems more probable, considering the song “Still Alive”, the cake room with the remaining personality cores and Doug Ratman’s statement “She is in the final chamber [with GLaDOS]”.

But then again: Why did he pick Chell anyway? To defeat GLaDOS? Why did he pick someone stubborn if not to resist the tests?

I never know when Chell actually rebels against GLaDOS or when she does something GLaDOS expected (or even hoped for).

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
This comic was really well made. Loved the bit where chell enters deep sleep and the thought of quantum entanglement rears its head.

Hope they do something like this for HL2: ep3…

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Piefish:

Is this comic canon? If it is then the whole relation between aperture and black mesa just became very different. What if Aperture had chargers from Black Mesa in order to test how they would work? What if they made their own versions of the chargers which were then modified for use by the combine?
SO much speculation so little time!

They’re just easter eggs man, calm down.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 Comic
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
Awesome comic. I love how it gives you a good sense of the things that happened before Portal 1.

Although I still don’t know whether Chell really fights with GLaDOS or whether this is just another part of her sick tests.
